summary: The Combating Cartels on Social Media Act of 2025 mandates a joint strategy by the Secretary of Homeland Security, Attorney General, and Secretary of State to combat transnational criminal organizations' recruitment efforts and illicit activities on social media and online platforms. It requires an assessment of these activities, including narcotics and weapons trafficking, human smuggling, and cybercrime. The strategy must include interagency cooperation, reporting mechanisms, international partnerships, youth outreach, and privacy protections. It also calls for regular reports to Congress and a civil rights/privacy assessment.
